intro: Paspalum koleopodum, commonly known as sandgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in sandy or coastal environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of grasses. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Paspalum koleopodum plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing soil erosion in coastal areas.
